1956

2000. 24 
985.36

5

Rwan

Emperial Medical College,

1th April

1912,

Frienterin 
Alfred . B. Stearns togre.

Your Kind letter dated the 5th of March 
1912 enclosing statement of account of muybon S.S. Kwan 
has reached me to day, and I hasten to apologize for 
my shortcomings in the delay of my remittance which 
ought to have been sent to you some mouths ago. My son 
was to have started for America five months ago, and 
passage was secured on board the s. s. Chuid. He proceeded 
asfar as to Shanghai where the strani of the Revolution 
has caused his stoppage, and he went 6 Hongkong to awair 
for further developements . my family and self had to leave 
for Hongkong, and had the calamity of witnessing the death 
of my old taker. Your other letters did not reach me at 
all except this one dated the 5th March, and most likely has 
got astrayed somewhere on account of the conditions of this 
comtry. However, I hope you will excuse me for my delay 
and I thank you much for the kind consideration you have 
extended on accormet of my son's affairs. I have just returned 
from the south about a week ago, and your kind wishes 
for the future of China is highly appreciated. Enclosed please 
find two drafts for the sum of $.1000624 gold, and for which 
your kind acknowledgement will be expected by

Hours Most Ameireles

HMwan.

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Handwritten letter acknowledging the account statement sent by the Academy and apologizing for delayed remittance. He describes the reasons for the delay in his son's arrival due to the strain of the Revolution. He apologizes for the delays in receipt of mail and encloses a draft for $1000.24 to settle the account.
